task.title: Tag words and phrases
task.shortdesc: It is a great idea to tag words and short phrases to classify them if they have special meaning.

context.p: Formatting with superscript, subscript, bold, italic, or underline is not the same as applying a tag. Applying a tag is almost always a better idea.
All other tags indicate the kind of content you are tagging. Choose the tag that describes the type of content.

step.cmd: Highlight the content you want to tag.
From the toolbar, select Add Description.
Select a tag that describes the content or formats it the way you need.

info.note: More than one tag can be applied at a time. If you do apply multiple tags, use the keyboard LEFT/RIGHT arrows to put your cursor in the place you need.

step.cmd: To modify or remove the classification, click the tagged content.

choices.choice: To modify, select the content you want to modify then select the tag button.

result.note: If you are tagging words or phrases as you type, use the right arrow on your keyboard to close the tag and continue authoring.
